summary:
New Orleans New Year Horror: 10 Dead, Public Outrage over 'DEI S**tshow'

Published on January 2, 2023 - Source: Times of India

New Orleans' New Year celebrations turned into a tragedy as at least 10 people were shot dead and 10 others injured in a crowded street near the French Quarter. The incident has sparked outrage, with many questioning the lack of police presence and control measures. Some users on social media have dubbed it a 'DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) s**tshow' and a 'terror attack', criticizing the city's policies.

  1. At least 10 people were killed and 10 more injured in a shooting near New Orleans' French Quarter on New Year's Eve.
  2. The incident has sparked public outrage, with many questioning the city's safety measures and policies.
  3. Some users on social media have criticized the city's 'DEI' policies, suggesting they may have contributed to the lack of control.
'This is a tragedy. We need answers and action now.' - New Orleans resident

With the city still grieving, authorities are investigating the incident and promising stricter control measures for future events.

title: Influencer chugs two bottles of whisky in 20 minutes to win ₹75,000 challenge, dies - Hindustan Times
summary:
A 21-Year-Old Influencer Dies After Whisky Challenge

Publication Date: January 1, 2025

A 21-year-old influencer in Thailand died after drinking two bottles of whisky in 20 minutes as part of a challenge. Thanakarn Kanthee, known as "Bank Leicester" online, accepted the challenge for money but died of alcohol poisoning.

  1. The influencer had previously taken on similar drinking challenges.
  2. The man who hired Kanthee for the challenge has been arrested and faces up to 10 years in jail.
  3. Video footage shows the crowd cheering as Kanthee collapsed.
  4. A social media post by Kanthee reveals he undertook such challenges to provide for his family.
"I am willing to be bullied and insulted to just get scraps of money from the rich people in order to provide for my family." - Thanakarn Kanthee

Source: Hindustan Times

title: Ukraine halts transit of Russian gas to Europe after a prewar deal expired - The Hindu
summary:
Ukraine halts transit of Russian gas to Europe after a prewar deal expired

Published on: January 01, 2025, by The Hindu

Ukraine has halted the flow of Russian gas supplies to European customers after a prewar transit deal expired, citing national security concerns. This decision follows nearly three years of conflict as Russia continues its invasion.

  • The energy minister, German Galushchenko, announced the stoppage “in the interest of national security.”
  • Russia’s Gazprom claims it lacks the ability to supply gas due to Ukraine's refusal to extend the transit deal.
  • The cease in gas transit could lead to significant financial losses for Russia as Europe aims to phase out Russian gas.
  • Prior to the war, Russia supplied approximately 40% of the EU's pipeline natural gas.
  • Ukraine's move aligns with Europe’s strategy to eliminate reliance on Russian gas by 2027.
“This is a historic event. Russia is losing markets and will incur financial losses.” - German Galushchenko

As a result of the ongoing conflict, Europe has begun diversifying its gas suppliers, significantly reducing dependence on Russian energy.
newTitle: Ukraine Stops Russian Gas Transit to Europe Amid Security Concerns

At least 10 people were killed and 30 more injured after a truck drove into a crowd on Bourbon Street in New Orleans. The driver exited the vehicle and began firing a weapon before police returned fire.

  • New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell described the incident as a “terrorist attack.”
  • Witnesses reported the driver firing a weapon after the crash.
  • Injured individuals were taken to five local hospitals.
  • The incident occurred shortly before the AllState Bowl college football game.
  • Historical context: Similar events have occurred in New Orleans, including previous shootings and vehicle attacks.

title: Russia ceases gas transit through Ukraine after over 30 years - The Times of India
summary:
Russia Ceases Gas Transit Through Ukraine

Date & Source: June 20, 2023, from Times of India

After over three decades, Russia has stopped gas transit through Ukraine. This decision, effective from June 20, 2023, comes amidst political tensions and Russia's increasing use of the Nord Stream 1 pipeline.

  • Russia cites maintenance work on the Nord Stream 1 pipeline as the reason for the halt.
  • The move could disrupt European gas supplies, as Ukraine is a major transit route for Russian gas to Europe.
  • The Ukrainian and European gas markets have been preparing for such a scenario.

Ukraine's state-owned energy company, Naftogaz, has already started preparations to cover gas supplies to customers, including using underground gas storage facilities.

Source: Times of India
newTitle: Russia Halts Gas Transit Through Ukraine After Three Decades

Russia launches New Year drone strike on Kyiv, officials say - The Hindu
summary:
Russia Launches New Year Drone Strike on Kyiv, Officials Say

Published: January 01, 2025, Source: The Hindu

In a recent escalation of conflict, Russia conducted a drone strike on the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, resulting in injuries and infrastructural damage.

  • The strike occurred on January 1, 2025, wounding at least three individuals.
  • Explosions were reported shortly after air defense systems detected approaching drones.
  • Mayor Vitali Klitschko confirmed damage to residential buildings along with debris affecting non-residential areas.
  • This incident is part of a broader pattern of Russian air strikes in the ongoing conflict with Ukraine.
“Debris had also damaged a non-residential premise in another neighbourhood,” said Mayor Klitschko.

This latest assault highlights the continuing threat posed by drone and missile attacks in the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, impacting civilians as the war persists into another year.
newTitle: Russia Launches New Year Drone Strike on Kyiv, Injuring Residents

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,042 - Al Jazeera English
Happy New Year 2025 LIVE: US rings in 2025 with dazzling fireworks display | Today News - Mint
As it happened | New Year 2025 Celebrations: New York City welcomes 2025 with Ball Drop moment - WION
summary:
World Welcomes 2025: Global New Year Celebrations

Published on January 1, 2025 - Source: The Public Live

The New Year's celebrations took place across the world as people enthusiastically marked the arrival of 2025. From small islands in the Pacific to energetic and busy cities, all welcomed the New Year with passion and thrill.

  1. New York City welcomed 2025 with the iconic 'Ball Drop' tradition at Times Square.
  2. The Rio Mayor's Press Office considers the New Year's Eve celebration in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, the world's biggest, with 2 million people expected to attend.
  3. The first ball drop in New York happened on December 31, 1907, and has been held every year since, except for 1942 and 1943 due to wartime blackouts.
  4. New Year celebrations around the world kicked off with fireworks and other festivities, including in Sydney, Australia, and New Zealand.
  5. Some countries held muted New Year events, such as South Korea, following recent tragic events.

New York City’s iconic Times Square was electric last night as the clock struck midnight, ringing in the year 2025 with an unforgettable celebration. Crowds gathered, bundled up and buzzing with excitement, to witness the historic ball drop, one of the most anticipated moments in… pic.twitter.com/GTAqYy619Y

— NYC Scoop (@NY_Scoop) January 1, 2025
newTitle: World Welcomes 2025: Global New Year Celebrations

title: Abu Dhabi sets Guinness record with stunning New Year fireworks, drone show - The Indian Express
summary:
Abu Dhabi Hosts Record-Breaking New Year Fireworks and Drone Show

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

As the world entered 2025, Abu Dhabi captivated audiences with a spectacular New Year’s Eve celebration featuring the largest fireworks display, alongside a record-setting drone show.

  • The 50-minute fireworks show took place at the Sheikh Zayed Festival in Al Wathba.
  • Over 6,000 drones participated, resulting in a Guinness World Record for the longest aerial display of 20 minutes.
  • Major locations like Yas Island and the Corniche contributed stunning pyrotechnics to the celebration.
  • In 2023, Abu Dhabi set three Guinness World Records during the Sheikh Zayed Festival with a 40-minute display.
“Abu Dhabi Breaks Guinness World Record with 50+ Mins Fireworks. Happy 2025. WHAT A MAGNIFICENT SIGHT.”

Despite the visual splendor, the event faced criticism on social media due to concerns about environmental impact.
newTitle: Abu Dhabi Hosts Record-Breaking New Year Fireworks and Drone Show
